content.question: Which of the following is most likely true if textile production generates pollution during the production process?

choices.label: The market will underproduce textiles relative to the socially optimal quantity, and the government would need to provide a lump-sum subsidy to firms to correct the externality.
The market will underproduce textiles relative to the socially optimal quantity, and the government would need to provide a per-unit subsidy to firms to correct the externality.
The market will overproduce textiles relative to the socially optimal quantity, and the government would need to impose a lump-sum tax on firms to correct the externality.
The market will overproduce textiles relative to the socially optimal quantity, and the government would need to impose a per-unit tax on firms to correct the externality.
The market will produce the socially optimal quantity of textiles, and the government would not need to intervene in the market to influence the production decisions of firms.

content.answer: The market will overproduce textiles relative to the socially optimal quantity, and the government would need to impose a per-unit tax on firms to correct the externality.
